CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1946, pg. 8, reads: "Double Ring Ceremony - Mr. and Mrs. Charles Benson Jr., were married Oct. 20 in a charming double ring ceremony performed at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Edgar Durrah. The bridal party included Walter Davidson, David Martin, William M. Coughman, Theodore Benson, the bride and groom , Rose Marie Benson, Helen McQueen, Maybelle Cobb and Lillian Watson. - Harris Photo." Accompanying article reads: "...Duquesne - Miss Willie Lee Durrah, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edgar Durrah, was united in marriage on Sunday evening, Oct. 20, with Charles Benson Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Benson, in a double ring ceremony held in home of the bride's parents.  The nuptials were read by the Rev. C. W. Torrey...The bride, given in marriage by her father, wore a white taffeta and net gown, with full skirt and sweetheart neckline appliqued with white pearls.  She wore a fingertip veil that fell from a pearl studded crown, and had a corsage of roses and white lilies of the valley.  She carried a white Bible.  Pastel shades were chosen by the attendants, who wore corsages of gardenias and roses.  The maid of honor was Rosa Marie Benson, a sister of the groom.  Bridesmaids were Helen McQueen, Lillian Watson and Maybelle Cobb.  Theodore Benson, a brother of the groom, was best man.  Ushers were Walter Davidson, David Martin and William M.  Coughman.  A reception was given on Monday, Oct. 21, at the American Legion Home.  The bride's mother wore a navy blue dress with a corsage of roses and lilies of the valley.  Mrs. Blanche Jarrett of New York, a sister of the bride, chose a black dress with a corsage of white gardenias.  Out-of-town guests included Mrs. Rena Thompson, Shirley Thompson, Mrs. Gussie English, Mrs. Erlene Goodman, all of Philadelphia, and who are relatives of the groom.  The happy couple left for a trip to New York."
TitMainTitle: Groom Charles Benson Jr., and bride Willie Lee Durrah Benson wearing gown with sweetheart neckline and long lace gloves, posed behind multi-tiered cake with foil leaf decorations, in Durrah home, Duquesne
